data.title: Concept Design Studios, Bozeman Montana
data.text:
Case Study: Montana Healthcare Foundation

Concept Design Studios has become MTHCF’s trusted partner, providing corporate-quality design and marketing materials aligned with their brand identity. Concept’s dedication to providing high-quality design and marketing services has earned them MTHCF’s trust, becoming an invaluable partner in their mission to improve the health and well-being of all Montanans.

Case Study: Big Sky Bravery

We provided Big Sky Bravery with the tools they needed to gain exposure for their mission through collaboration of design and apparel. When there is a line to get hands on your apparel, then everyone wins!

Case Study: Blue Collar Restaurant Group

BCRG is known for delicious restaurants across the western U.S. such as Sidewinders American Grill, Tanglewood Grill & Tap, Hachi Sushi Pub, and Liberty Burger. Concept provided a fulfillment program that incorporates online ordering, apparel fulfillment and distribution, warehousing, and design to make uniform management easier.

Case Study: Beaverhead Motorsports

We created value for Beaverhead Motorsports by walking them through the process of updating their brand without losing what made them special in the first place.

NOVA Women’s Health Case Study

With the help of Concept Design Studios focusing on building community recognition for Nova, Dr. Putnam was able to focus more on her main goal of providing healthcare to women in the community.

Proper Insurance Case Study

We take pride in offering products and solutions that are customized for your goals and recommending products that are right for you. Our experience with creating marketing solutions for over 1000 brands allows us to provide large scale marketing strategies to businesses of any size.

Museum of the Rockies Re-Designs

We have had so much fun with this project for Museum of the Rockies. They came to us to help them refresh their store at the museum – tshirts, stickers, mugs, etc. They were excited to be able to get custom, professional designs that were completely unique to them. Once we came up with the […]

Phillips Hardwood Floors Logo Design

Phillips Hardwood Floors came to us to refresh their logo. We really enjoyed this project and we came up with the end result that they truly wanted. They wanted a combination of modern and traditional, like the work that they do in their own business. We started our initial designs with a more modern acorn and then […]

Wildrye Distilling

We have really enjoyed this recent group of projects that we have been able to partner with Wildrye on. We have reworked the design of their labels and cap straps. We are also working on the design of their new website (coming soon)! Phil, the owner, is truly an artisan and we really enjoy working […]

Bloom – Making Skin Happy Label Design & Printing

We loved working on this project with Bev at Bloom. We designed and printed labels for her sample size shampoo, conditioner, lotion, face wash and body wash. Check out her organic skin care website here. Great organic skincare products.

Wedding Banner

We were asked to create a banner for a wedding that takes place in a beautiful red barn. Our clients wanted a banner that was both elegant and a bit western and rustic. This is the banner she choose after we gave her a few options. We often show you what we do for businesses […]

Custom Cut Digital Vinyl – Red Tractor Pizza

Here is another piece of vinyl that we did for Red Tractor Pizza on Main Street. Ward Co designs designed this for Red Tractor Pizza and so we were able to print it with their files. We can print full-color vinyl on our large format printer and cut it out to any custom-shape. The skies […]

Feed Cafe – Opening!

The owners of the Nova Cafe have started a new venture, The Feed Cafe. It is due to open this week. We were able to help the Feed Cafe with their new signs for their new location, the Kirk Homestead or what most people know it as: “The Red Barn”. We used an aluminum, custom […]

Ernie’s Bakery – West Yellowstone

Ernie’s Bakery recently changed management after over 30 years in West Yellowstone, Montana. The new owners wanted to re-brand and update all of their marketing products to fit their goals and aspirations for the future of their new business. They wanted a West Yellowstone experience: friendly and rustic with a vintage feel, all of which fit […]

Montana 406 Real Estate

Montana 406 approached us to help them re-brand as they were breaking off to be their own brokerage firm. Previously, they had incorporated the state of Montana into their logo but they wanted to update it in order to appeal to their desired and current customer base. We have helped them with everything from logo […]

Marketing Survey Mailer – Jonny’s Appliance

Jonny’s Appliance & TV Repair is a local, family-owned business that is always striving to serve their customers better. We were able to help meet that desire with a custom design of a postcard mailer with a customer survey. We partnered with them to help accomplish one of their marketing goals – gaining the trust […]

Custom Logo Apparel – Anderson and Platt

Anderson & Platt Flyfishers have been guiding for over 10 years and decided to take the leap to open their own retail shop April 1st 2013. We helped them add some promotional products to their store. Their logo has multiple colors as well as a hand-painted fin which is very hard to recreate with embroidery […]

New Website – Spruce & Honey Waxing Parlor

We have just completed a website design project for Spruce and Honey Waxing Parlor. Here’s a little about Spruce and Honey… Located in the charming Mill District of Bozeman, Spruce and Honey is a friendly neighborhood waxing parlor designed to meet all of your skin care and waxing needs. The beautiful and bright space also […]
